availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William "Wilburn" Bagwell (Scottsville, Kentucky, farmer & pvt, corp 37th KY Inf USA)

body.p: Scottsville, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Allen Bagwell and Elizabeth Bagwell. Resident of Barren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Scottsville in 1860. Served in the 37th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private and corporal from September 17, 1863, to December 29, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, District 1, p. 379B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Allen County, Carolina District, p. 388.

Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0417.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #547608, Certificate #361249.
Find A Grave, "William Wilburn Bagwell (1846-1919)," Memorial #10707597, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/10707597 (accessed December 8, 2020).
